Many students will wish to deepen their expertise in a discipline or domain. To that end, we recommend course sequences around typical disciplines and domains. Students wishing to take elective courses not in the list need permission of the Director of Graduate Studies.   For students in the MSDS program, the timing of elective courses differs according to whether students are in the 3- or 4- semester plan.   In the 4-semester plan, this sequence of electives would be typical:     First semester (Fall): 1 elective   Second semester (Spring): 1 elective   Third semester (Fall): 1 elective   Fourth semester (Spring): 3 electives     In the 3-semester plan, this sequence of electives would be typical:     First semester (Fall): 3 electives   Second semester (Spring): 3 electives   Third semester (Fall): no electives     Note that some courses have prerequisites, which are not listed. You will need to consult the department website for such details. Often a search on “NYU” + the course name will lead to details for the course.     Electives by Discipline or Domain   These collections of courses are organized around specific disciplines and domains. Be aware that the courses listed are not necessarily offered every semester.  All are 3 credits except where noted otherwise. Many students will wish to deepen their expertise in a discipline or domain. To that end, we recommend course sequences around typical disciplines and domains. Students wishing to take elective courses not in the list need permission of the Director of Graduate Studies.   For students in the MSDS program, the timing of elective courses differs according to whether students are in the 3- or 4- semester plan.   In the 4-semester plan, this sequence of electives would be typical:     First semester (Fall): 1 elective   Second semester (Spring): 1 elective   Third semester (Fall): 1 elective   Fourth semester (Spring): 3 electives     In the 3-semester plan, this sequence of electives would be typical:     First semester (Fall): 3 electives   Second semester (Spring): 3 electives   Third semester (Fall): no electives     Note that some courses have prerequisites, which are not listed. You will need to consult the department website for such details. Often a search on “NYU” + the course name will lead to details for the course.     Electives by Discipline or Domain   These collections of courses are organized around specific disciplines and domains. Be aware that the courses listed are not necessarily offered every semester.  All are 3 credits except where noted otherwise.
